DataElement.preferredName: Very Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performed Result Value in mg/dL
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the amount  of very low density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood measured in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Very Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of very low-density lipoprotein cholesterol present in a sample._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Very Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Measurement Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of very low-density lipoprotein cholesterol present in a sample.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.longName: Very Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Measurement
Concepts.definition: The determination of the amount of very low-density lipoprotein cholesterol present in a sample.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A laboratory result using the metric measure of milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/20/13 unretired; VD reused outside FBPP content. jc  2/9/12 - Retired as part of content cleanup activities per concurrence with Jenny Larkin (NHLBI).

ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the value of very low density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood measured in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)?
